article.headline: Brown 69, Cornell 66
article.story: ITHACA, N.Y. (AP) -- Patrick Powers scored 14 of his 19 points in the second half to lift Brown to a 69-66 victory over Cornell Saturday night. The Bears (14-13, 10-4) jumped out to a 7-2 lead on a pair of turnaround jump shots by Jaime Kilburn and a 3-pointer by Mike Martin. Cornell (11-16, 6-9) rallied to tie, but Brown answered with a 13-0 run to extend the lead to 20-7. The Bears went up 30-22 with a minute to play on a spinning layup by Jason Forte in the lane and led 33-24 at halftime. In the second half, a steal by Cornell's Graham Dow and coast-to-coast layup with 8:30 to play followed by a fastbreak layup by Gabe Stephenson 15 seconds later evened the contest at 52-52. Powers connected on two free throws with 7:58 left, giving Brown the lead for good, 54-52. The Bears led by as many as five points down the stretch, grabbing a 65-60 lead on a Powers layup with 2:50 remaining. Ka'Ron Barnes led the Big Red with a game-high 20 points. Stephenson finished with 19 points, 17 in the second half. Kilburn scored 15 points for Brown. Martin and Forte added 14 each.
